snippet: The largest federally subsidized artist's colony in the country suffered the fate of many in Lower Manhattan when flood waters from Hurricane Sandy surged into the West Village building and ruined decades of art.
abstract: The largest federally subsidized artist's colony in the country suffered the fate of many in Lower Manhattan when flood waters from Hurricane Sandy surged into the West Village building and ruined decades of art.

headline.main: A Lifetime of Work Destroyed at Westbeth
headline.print_headline: Lifetimes of Artwork Destroyed at Artists’ Colony
